That is to say, all bodhisattvas first, on the ground of resolute practice, through the ten practices of the Dharma, cultivate resolute forbearance to the utmost, and thus transcend that ground and realize entry into the bodhisattva's correct nature, which is free from birth.

That is to say, the bodhisattvas, with regard to the sentient beings included in the first three perfections, by means of the skillful means of the four means of conversion, skillfully convert them and place them in the good destinies. If bodhisattvas, because of the causes and conditions of associating with good people, listening to the true Dharma, and proper contemplation, transform inferior resolve into superior resolve and also attain the superior understanding of the upper realms, this is called the perfection of power.
Because of this power, one is able to endure abiding in one's own mind. Therefore, I say that the perfection of power is an assistant to the perfection of meditation.
If bodhisattvas, because of having already been able to hear and contemplate the bodhisattva canon and cultivate it well, are able to give rise to meditation, this is called the perfection of wisdom.
Because of this wisdom, one is able to draw forth supramundane wisdom. Therefore, I say that the perfection of wisdom is an assistant to the perfection of wisdom.

In this way, sentient beings are by nature suffering due to the suffering of conditioned existence.
